alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 25 at 7:40PM CST until December 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana... Pearl River Near Pearl River affecting Pearl River, Hancock and St. Tammany Counties. Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Pearl River, Washington, Hancock and St. Tammany Counties. For the Lower Pearl River...including Bogalusa, Pearl River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Bogalusa. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Woodlands and crop acreage along the river will be flooded. The Bogue Chitto Wildlife Management area will be inundated with water in recreational camps and over access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM CST Sunday was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday morning and continue falling to 13.1 feet Wednesday, January 04. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.3 feet on 02/21/1982. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
